author: Corbin McGuire corbin@emporia.com
title: Chase County rolls past Herington
text:
Chase County’s Kraig Hatcher carried the load in a 46-0 road win against Herington Friday night, but his front five helped clear the way for his breakout night. 
Hatcher finished with 226 rushing yards on 24 carries, three of which he took to the house. 
“I think Kraig would be the first guy to tell you that Jake Wessel and the offensive line deserve a lot of that credit,” CCHS head coach Derick Budke said. “They got into the second level, he did a great job of making some cuts.” 
Budke praised the play of his quarterback Brett Engle, who scored via a touchdown pass and a touchdown run while also snagging an interception on defense. 
“Overall I thought Brett Engle had the best game of his high school career,” Budke said of Engle, who completed 3 of 5 passes for 44 yards, all of which went to Alec Keller. “He had great decision making all night, so he really stood out.” 
The Bulldogs led 27-0 at halftime, but weren’t playing the brand of football Budke wanted to see. 
“I thought we had a little bit of a choppy first half,” Budke said. “We managed to score, but we played choppy, not a lot of rhythm. It got real chippy out there on the football field and I thought we got distracted. We had five penalties in the first half, two of which were personal fouls. 
“At halftime we challenged our guys to play to our standard, play to our level. We wanted our guys to remember how hard we play and our guys did an outstanding job of that in the second half.” 
After the halftime discussion about it, his players righted what little mistakes they made en route to their second win of the season. 
“We’ve been a pretty good defensive bunch all year. I think we gave up three first downs all night,” Budke said. “We had some young guys in there and they played with a lot of pride, that’s good to see.” 
Chase County improved to 2-4 on the season and 1-1 in district play. The Bulldogs host Mission Valley next Friday. 
Chase County 14 13 12 7 — 46 
Herington 0 0 0 0 — 0
